intro: Lesquerella navajoensis, commonly known as Navajo lesquerella, is a rare and endemic species native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems, adapted to thrive in arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain oily seeds, which have potential industrial applications. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
